author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Social Justice Party activists came to the City Police Commissioner’s office on Monday, to lodge a complaint against Minister of State for Road Transport, Highways and Shipping Pon. Radhakrishnan for riding a motor bike without wearing a helmet.

President of the party N. Paneerselvam claimed that the Minister and a few senior party functionaries rode two-wheelers without wearing a helmet during a rally that started from the BJP office on the VKK Menon Road on Sunday.

“Photographs of the rally had appeared in many newspapers today,” he said.

He added that the Minister who is expected to set an example to the public by wearing helmets (as wearing helmets have been mandatory by the Madras High Court from July 1 last year) has chosen not to wear it.

The petition asked the police commissioner to initiate action against the Union Minister and BJP functionaries under Section 129 of the Motor Vehicle Act.
title: Complaint against Union Minister
